bow: any other working moms out there relate to this text just sent my husband yeah related to that for about months before quit my full time job and started working at home part time never looked back does your husband help with things at home ve started handing off not just tasks but mental load associated with things full responsibility made it clear not project manager and so if we run out of things or something doesn work out we are both responsible sahp but if was still working my husband and would likely be separated by now sorry hope he gets it in gear right there with you ve had the need more help and need you to just handle some of the things that are frequent occurrences within our household conversation so many times and the response get is well if you need help then you need to ask removed that is the exact conversation keep having with my dh ve started replying with not your mother it is not my responsibility to tell you to pick up after yourself and or you have two perfectly good eyes surely you can see what needs to be done removed feel like this but as single mom my son comes home talking about the fun things he did at his dads and over here drowning like wtf kudos to you for being able to calmly articulate your feelings legit proud of you ❤️ absolutely just had this argument last week we both work full time with alternating shifts that way one of us is always home with the kids and we don have to pay sitter the pros to our situation we get to raise our twins on our own and never feel like we re missing out plus we save ton of money the cons work night shift the kids bedtime is literally right when leave they sleep for 12 hours straight this gives dad full 12 hours to have peace decompress play video games smoke weed and to sleep lavishly every single day come home and get maybe hours of uninterrupted sleep before he leaves then up all day with them we do get one nap day but running on fumes by my 5th day of work since get them when they re awake make all the bottles feed all the meals bathe them take them to appointments run errands with them change almost all the diapers the list goes on he had four day weekend for independence day and took over since he was at home slept 12+ hours everyday and got to go to brunch it was amazing this do not want to have to ask dh to help with things see need meet need am neither your teacher nor your parent or pm love that analogy giving him full autonomy over certain things has been met with lots of complaining but think over time it will improve know exactly how you feel unfortunately for me my situation is only minimally better he started listening more and helping it irritating to some to call the husband baby dad role as helping but when that what yours does it really hard not to keep track of who does what and count everything tbh it probably makes it worse on your mental health to do it have no real advice but will say that it did get incrementally better once we moved our baby to his own room around months was able to do little more around the house after he is down and know that did have to go to bed when put him down due to him sleeping more at night and being more predictable op it does get better as the baby ages know everyone says that but in my experience so far it really does get little easier do think your husband will understand without being fully responsible for the baby for few days or without joint counseling removed you must have way more stressful job than me girl this is living nightmare humans need sleep you can not keep going like this asked my husband few months ago if he would prefer that just tell him what needs to be around the house to help me maintain my sanity he said yes so now tell him what needs to be done unfortunately it feels like parenting him but he oblivious to what needs to be done and he not mind reader there has been such shift in our marriage since started telling him what needs to be done and it good one feel less overwhelmed and going to be when he goes to bed but of course still sleeping less bc bf mom but also started waking him up if lo mo is having one of those nights also started telling him what chores expect our teenagers to get done during the day step sons 15 amp 13 because tired of telling them the same stuff that needs to get done weekly think he starting to see my frustration proud of you for sending that send lot of important conversations via text and then follow up when we re together if life at home gets too busy sometimes those conversations can get left behind so see how text can be sufficient but be sure to follow up face to face we keep revisiting what works my husband just owns categories of things that happen *daily* read while back that the chores men do are less repetitive and can be put off so that there less mental pressure so we decide the drudgery he is responsible for washing dishes also do you have lawn do the mowing pruning etc and it is joyously relaxing some other thoughts we together put any material thing run out of on shared grocery list app listed by store so that no one needs to manage that my husband every weeks does the walmart run in the morning before work making it automatic takes off to do list item we share things so that there is less to mentally manage like sharing shampoo and liquid soap our children have limited sets of toys and less but high quality clothes again less to manage we hire out handyman tasks which take my husband long time to complete bunch whole bundle of like take like fixing hinges and attaching bookshelves and call or hanuman when have full day worth my husband and have one day off week from childcare so even if we re together one of us is parenting and one of us is mentally resting and enjoying there are so many things that can make your life easier in addition to your partner vstepping up in the long run both streamlining and moving some work off of you to your husband or someone else will help you create space removed yup this is exactly how felt shortly before quitting my teaching career to work from home part time also noragrets finally realized it was just really terrible work life balance more than partner problem he would pick up or shop or cook but never had the time and energy to invest as much as *i* felt was needed or to do the things with and for my children that embodied my parenting philosophy basically the life created with my career choices was getting in the way of the life that wanted invested my summer off into creating startup for side income literally no netflix no amazon prime no eating out it been an extremely trying year financially but would trade it for anything parent is here to run the household my mental health is getting back on track and my kids have my attention that the life always envisioned and the financial goals will come with time gt the kids bedtime is literally right after leave they sleep for 12 hours straight is their bedtime drink triple whiskey somewhat make sure you are only dividing up the physical chores responsibilities but also the mental ones moms tend to take all the mental ones on and hoard those instead of being like ayo husband you re now in charge of making sure kiddo goes to the dentist regularly my life is much better since gave husband his own list of mental tasks removed totally get what you re saying feel like that too it like you live here ca you see what needs to be done without me asking found though in my years of marriage and raising kids sometimes they really just do get it ve had to get super specific in my requests will you please wash the dishes that are still in the sink can you please fold the laundry that in the dryer can you please give kid bath before 6:00 etc it annoying to have to be so specific but genuinely think sometimes they just do get it at all it annoying to have to dictate but it also frustrating to do all the work yourself best of luck hope you are able to get break soon same for you op know haha sleep training has worked wonders think gave my husband an ah ha moment one night we had put off grocery shopping for bit too long so we had items that could make up meal but they were all missing or ingredients so asked him to go to the store he grumbled and asked why did get it on the way home told him did know what was in the cupboard so could stop and get things did know what to get he got quiet so very pointedly asked am supposed to keep track of everything in the cupboard is that your expectation of me and he sort of got sheepish look and mumbled no half of the stuff we do goes unnoticed because it literally invisible it knowing if there is milk in the fridge or if it theme day at preschool or remembering to send diapers to daycare it having mental tally on what bills are paid or not paid watching that mysterious bruise on your kids arm in case it pattern and gets bigger coordinating schedules especially if your kid is special needs and has lot of appointments coordinating your social life it all of that and more but because these things are physically apparent they do notice them because they are just done currently work full time and have considered going back to school to earn teacher certification however am also debating on just saving money and open whatever business when the opportunity presents what was your experience with teaching ve found that combining full time working single parenting households with my bestie and her children has been one of my greatest life decisions the dishwasher emptying laundry doing and food making is only vaginally operated because we live in an estrogen palace super into this man hating cat hoarding chapter of my life holy crap the mental tally thing is spot on do know if it woman mom thing or what but able to remember keep track of all sorts of weird stuff like you listed how many half gallons of milk at in the fridge what size diapers he in how many packs of wipes we have at home if the wipes are cheaper currently at sam or costco could go on feel like my husband actually expects me to know all of this and it feels insane would never expect this of my husband so why would he expect this of me removed seeing lot of comments about needing partners to help but that implies it all our responsibility and we need assistance with it if the partner is not an actual partner they need to step up or get lost yeah we need to spell it out to them in non ultimatum kind of way because ultimately we want them around but to pull their weight and if we do tell them there problem we ca expect them to be mind readers but as long as we re viewing ourselves as the default housekeeper kin keeper child minder we re contributing to the issue removed yup have found that have to be really specific with the hubs with what need otherwise it doesn happen think mostly because of how he was raised his mom was sahm and did everything and the only thing will do it removed removed removed removed removed removed removed this is infuriating and know my husband will not improve it the biggest reason decided to be stay at home mom and why we waited until keep this in mind just stop doing all of it then stop doing everything my husband and both work full time with two littles it worked for us to each have assigned areas of the house ie he in charge of all things kitchen related and keep the rest of the house in order and do laundry he does the kids night routine and do the morning obviously what works for us won work for everyone but in general we found having assignments that don change for keeping the house in order or otherwise and are larger than task level to do has kept us accountable allowed us to make our own rhythm for how and when we manage our own areas and made it easier to see where we can help each other ie for our situation if he having hard week and is behind on the dishes he super grateful if just hop in and do load for him or vice versa when he does load of laundry for me which makes us appreciate each other more glad to help check on the spare outfit too because guarantee it the wrong size if you re anything like me this sounds like financial abuse by your husband you should consider reaching out to some support services family or friends for your and your children sake this so much this have so much to add but in the end feel like this is battle that will end with me settling his belongings including his phone on fire because he just like to relax both my husband and work full time and insist on weekends holidays being family time but he always wants to relax it kills me question why are you responsible for the majority of the chores when he home with the toddler doesn make logistical sense to me honestly curious do it he literally put you on charge of keeping him in line right his mom was sahm god damn superwoman she legit amazing and did all the cooking cleaning and home repair and errands it was 24 job with no sick days or vacation my husband and both felt it was right and that things should be more evenly distributed when our daughter was an infant and needed to eat every hours not much else could be done during the day now that she toddler and entertains herself he still reluctant to take on more responsibilities since he likes playing on his computer all day he does have thing where he hates getting chemicals on his hands and changing garbages makes him gag we did try him cooking dinner though had to pre prep everything but he would decide he did want to and order take out which was costing us fortune but yes he could absolutely be doing more like sweeping and wiping things down or running errands do think part of it is that gender norms are so instilled in society that even though my husband likes to say he progressive in that he sahd he still feels the cleaning and cooking should default to me because even when his mom got job when his parents got divorced she still did all everything since there was no one else to come on raising your kids on your own is not benefit when it means you only get **4** hours of sleep night while working full time that bananas the stigma around having childcare has been overblown to ridiculous degree you need to accept that having childcare help does not make you less of parent to your twins parenting daily on fumes is ultimately doing more harm than having help saaaaaaame yes had very similar moment recently we went away for weekend and forgot to pack the pack play whoops noticed it 40 minutes into our drive and before there was chance to point fingers said it very hard to remember everything can only do so much between packing for myself the kids all the food strollers carriers etc if you expect me to take responsibility for all the packing please understand mistakes will happen can only remember so much refuse to blame myself since he also hadn thought of it or wanted to think of it it ended up being good exercise on us brainstorming together on how to remedy the no pack play situation on our vacation sometimes but recognize its on me my man does ton around the house and do too we are both tired hired cleaning service and it has done wonders for my mental health find myself getting excited for when they are scheduled to come because its one of the few times feel free from stress we do go on dates much anymore or out to eat like we used to our money is spent in different ways now so think it good investment if you can find way to offload any of the tasks that you have to an agency would recommend it cleaning laundry lawn service child watch for day even something have you ever lived on your own some lot of but not all bachelors have very different standards about their living arrangements cleanliness my husband has done really great job since we got married learning how to actually take care of an apartment but the things he does now never got done when he lived alone with male roommates cleaning the tub it would get cleaned one time right before moving out and that it mopping yeah right sweeping only and if you spill something just wipe it up with paper towel reach quick lot of men just don care about the mess don notice it not freakishly tidy person either but my idea of dirty apartment and his idea of dirty apartment were very different for at least the first months of marriage and maybe more so often do believe men when they said they didn notice but my husband didn notice lot of things until taught him to he has learned though hoping the same proves true when baby gets here this happened to us too before and had the same reaction basically it not just up to *me* to remember things fortunately it was early enough on that we still could use the baby box that we loaded everything into which my husband had not wanted to bring studies have shown same sex couples to be lot more equitable in chore allocation women with sahd partners do lot more housework than their male counterparts with sahm partners too have her teach you the individual tasks you re struggling with but actually listen and learn when she does so she only needs to teach you once grab note pad take notes ask questions also when in doubt google learned so many household tasks chores from the internet didn know how to iron collared shirt because neither of my parents really ever wore them so googled didn know how to clean base boards because my childhood home didn have them so googled if it task that isn unique to all or something she wants done super particular way then just look it up on youtube you could also ask if there category of chore that you could permanently take on to help her dishes or sweeping the kitchen and wiping down the counter tops every day stuff like that and then stick with it and actually do that chore every single time temporary anxiety is normal think doing household stuff can be especially hard if you re worried about being criticized afterwards or having your work picked apart if that sounds familiar to you then you could also sit down and have discussion about work quality criticism think that if you put good faith effort into learning how to do task and if you then put good faith effort into doing that task regularly once you ve learned how then no one should be criticizing the tiny details of that task if you re doing it wrong in way where it is potentially damaging or no longer helpful to anyone then obviously your wife should intervene but both parties need to agree not to sweat the small stuff if you re doing your best at task not lot of info from that vague text ve been reading household management tips lately you may want to pick up book on it adulting is my current read one that might help is whenever you re moving between rooms tidy by taking something with you to put back eg to garbage laundry sink recycling also any time you re just sitting around think if there something you could be multitasking at like shredding old documents or folding laundry you could also do rounds to check on things like recycling and garbage levels to see when they need emptying out or when things like diaper stations need refilling it might take one last round of demonstrations from your wife to get things like laundry on the same page but take your own notes which she should look over to stick close by so you have explicit instructions in future if you don already do it an app you can both use to add to cart for grocery pickup would streamline things for everyone you can add things you see getting low place orders and pick them up after work so there are always groceries around without having to take big trip for them laundry tags are on the side brand sizing tags are on the back though the latter have been replaced by printed in labels most of the time these days to avoid sensory issues especially these days yeah now you tell me ouch yes we have weekly family meeting that really helped us with this
